   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test encode/decode of dictionary-related modules. Each test case
   23: %% runs multiple tests in parallel since many of the tests are just
   24: %% the same code with different in-data: implementing each test as a
   25: %% single testcase would make for much duplication with ct's current
   26: %% requirement of one function per testcase.
   27: %%
   28: 
   29: -module(diameter_codec_SUITE).
   30: 
   31: %% testcases, no common_test dependency
   32: -export([run/0,
   33:          run/1]).
   34: 
   35: %% common_test wrapping
   36: -export([
   37:          %% Framework functions
   38:          suite/0,
   39:          all/0,
   40:          init_per_suite/1,
   41:          end_per_suite/1,
   42:          init_per_testcase/2,
   43:          end_per_testcase/2,
   44: 
   45:          %% The test cases
   46:          base/1,
   47:          gen/1,
   48:          lib/1,
   49:          unknown/1,
   50:          recode/1
   51:         ]).
   52: 
   53: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   54: 
   55: -include("diameter_util.hrl").
   56: 
   57: 
   58: -define(CL(F),    ?CL(F, [])).
   59: -define(CL(F, A), ?LOG("DCS", F, A)).
   60: -define(L,        atom_to_list).
   61: 
   62: 
   63: %% ===========================================================================
   64: 
   65: suite() ->
   66:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   67: 
   68: all() ->
   69:     [
   70:      base,
   71:      gen,
   72:      lib,
   73:      unknown,
   74:      recode
   75:     ].
   76: 
   77: 
   78: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   79:     ?DUTIL:init_per_suite(Config).
   80: 
   81: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   82:     ?DUTIL:end_per_suite(Config).
   83: 
   84: 
   85: %% This test case can take a *long* time, so if the machine is too slow, skip
   86: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   87:     ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> check factor", [Case]),
   88:     Key = dia_factor,
   89:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Config) of
   90:         {value, {Key, Factor}} when (Factor > 10) ->
   91:             ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> Too slow (~w) => SKIP",
   92:                 [Case, Factor]),
   93:             {skip, {machine_too_slow, Factor}};
   94:         _ ->
   95:             ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> run test", [Case]),
   96:             Config
   97:     end;
   98: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   99:     ?CL("init_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  100:     Config.
  101: 
  102: 
  103: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  104:     ?CL("end_per_testcase(~w) -> entry", [Case]),
  105:     Config.
  106: 
  107: 
  108: %% ===========================================================================
  109: 
  110: base(_Config) ->
  111:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  112:     Res = run(base),
  113:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  114:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  115:     Res.
  116: 
  117: gen(_Config) ->
  118:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  119:     Res = run(gen),
  120:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  121:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  122:     Res.
  123: 
  124: lib(_Config) ->
  125:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  126:     Res = run(lib),
  127:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  128:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  129:     Res.
  130: 
  131: unknown(Config) ->
  132:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  133:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  134:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  135:     Res  = unknown(Priv, Data),
  136:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  137:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  138:     Res.
  139: 
  140: recode(_Config) ->
  141:     ?CL("~w -> entry", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  142:     Res = run(recode),
  143:     ?CL("~w -> done when"
  144:         "~n   Res: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Res]),
  145:     Res.
  146: 
  147: 
  148: %% ===========================================================================
  149: 
  150: %% run/0
  151: 
  152: run() ->
  153:     run(all()).
  154: 
  155: %% run/1
  156: 
  157: run(base) ->
  158:     diameter_codec_test:base();
  159: 
  160: run(gen) ->
  161:     [{application, diameter, App}] = diameter_util:consult(diameter, app),
  162:     {modules, Ms} = lists:keyfind(modules, 1, App),
  163:     [_|_] = Gs = lists:filter(fun(M) ->
  164:                                       lists:prefix("diameter_gen_", ?L(M))
  165:                               end,
  166:                               Ms),
  167:     lists:foreach(fun diameter_codec_test:gen/1, Gs);
  168: 
  169: run(lib) ->
  170:     diameter_codec_test:lib();
  171: 
  172: %% Have a separate AVP dictionary just to exercise more code.
  173: run(unknown) ->
  174:     PD = ?MKTEMP("diameter_codec"),
  175:     DD = filename:join([code:lib_dir(diameter),
  176:                         "test",
  177:                         "diameter_codec_SUITE_data"]),
  178:     try
  179:         unknown(PD, DD)
  180:     after
  181:         file:del_dir_r(PD)
  182:     end;
  183: 
  184: run(success) ->
  185:     success();
  186: 
  187: run(grouped_error) ->
  188:     grouped_error();
  189: 
  190: run(failed_error) ->
  191:     failed_error();
  192: 
  193: run(recode) ->
  194:     ok = diameter:start(),
  195:     try
  196:         ?RUN([{?MODULE, run, [F]} || F  <- [success,
  197:                                             grouped_error,
  198:                                             failed_error]])
  199:     after
  200:         ok = diameter:stop()
  201:     end;
  202: 
  203: run(List) ->
  204:     ?RUN([{{?MODULE, run, [F]}, 10000} || F <- List]).
  205: 
  206: 
  207: %% ===========================================================================
  208: 
  209: unknown(Priv, Data) ->
  210:     ?CL("~w -> entry with"
  211:         "~n   Priv dir: ~p"
  212:         "~n   Data dir: ~p"
  213:         "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Priv, Data]),
  214:     ok = make(Data, "recv.dia", Priv),
  215:     ok = make(Data, "avps.dia", Priv),
  216:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_avps.erl"),
  217:     ok = make(Data, "send.dia", Priv),
  218:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_send.erl"),
  219:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv, "diameter_test_recv.erl"),
  220:     {ok, _, _} = compile(Priv,
  221:                          filename:join([Data, "diameter_test_unknown.erl"]),
  222:                          [{i, Priv}]),
  223:     diameter_test_unknown:run().
  224: 
  225: make(Dir, File, Out) ->
  226:     ?CL("~w -> entry with"
  227:         "~n   File: ~p"
  228:         "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, File]),
  229:     pcall(fun() ->
  230:                   diameter_make:codec(filename:join(Dir, File), [{outdir, Out}])
  231:           end, 5000).
  232: 
  233: compile(Dir, File) ->
  234:     compile(Dir, File, []).
  235: 
  236: compile(Dir, File, Opts) ->
  237:     ?CL("~w -> entry with"
  238:         "~n   File: ~p"
  239:         "~n   Opts: ~p"
  240:         "~n", [?FUNCTION_NAME, File, Opts]),
  241:     pcall(fun() ->
  242:                   compile:file(filename:join(Dir, File), [return | Opts])
  243:           end).
  244: 
  245: 
  246: pcall(F) when is_function(F) ->
  247:     pcall(F, infinity, ?SECS(1)).
  248: 
  249: pcall(F, Timeout)
  250:   when is_function(F) andalso is_integer(Timeout) andalso (Timeout > 0) ->
  251:     TMP = Timeout div 4,
  252:     PollTimeout =
  253:         if
  254:             (TMP > 1000) ->
  255:                 1000;
  256:             true ->
  257:                 TMP
  258:         end,
  259:     pcall(F, Timeout, PollTimeout).
  260: 
  261: 
  262: pcall(F, Timeout, PollTimeout)
  263:   when is_function(F) andalso
  264:        is_integer(Timeout) andalso
  265:        ((PollTimeout =:= infinity) orelse
  266:         (is_integer(PollTimeout) andalso (Timeout > PollTimeout))) ->
  267:     ?PCALL(F, Timeout, PollTimeout);
  268: pcall(F, Timeout, PollTimeout) 
  269:   when is_function(F) andalso
  270:        (Timeout =:= infinity) andalso
  271:        ((PollTimeout =:= infinity) orelse
  272:         (is_integer(PollTimeout) andalso (PollTimeout > 0))) ->
  273:     ?PCALL(F, Timeout, PollTimeout).
  274: 
  275: 
  276: 
  277: 
  278: 
  279: 
  280: %% ===========================================================================
  281: 
  282: %% Ensure a Grouped AVP is represented by a list in the avps field.
  283: success() ->
  284:     Avps = [{295, <<1:32>>},  %% Termination-Cause
  285:             {284, [{280, "Proxy-Host"}, %% Proxy-Info
  286:                    {33, "Proxy-State"}, %%
  287:                    {295, <<2:32>>}]}],  %% Termination-Cause
  288:     #diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 295,
  289:                                            value = 1,
  290:                                            data = <<1:32>>},
  291:                              [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  292:                               #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  293:                               #diameter_avp{code = 33},
  294:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  295:                                             value = 2,
  296:                                             data = <<2:32>>}]],
  297:                      errors = []}
  298:         = str(repkg(str(Avps))).
  299: 
  300: %% ===========================================================================
  301: 
  302: %% Ensure a Grouped AVP is represented by a list in the avps field
  303: %% even in the case of a decode error on a component AVP.
  304: grouped_error() ->
  305:     Avps = [{295, <<1:32>>},  %% Termination-Cause
  306:             {284, [{295, <<0:32>>},      %% Proxy-Info, Termination-Cause
  307:                    {280, "Proxy-Host"},
  308:                    {33, "Proxy-State"}]}],
  309:     #diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 295,
  310:                                            value = 1,
  311:                                            data = <<1:32>>},
  312:                              [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  313:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  314:                                             value = undefined,
  315:                                             data = <<0:32>>},
  316:                               #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  317:                               #diameter_avp{code = 33}]],
  318:                      errors = [{5004, #diameter_avp{code = 284}}]}
  319:         = str(repkg(str(Avps))).
  320: 
  321: %% ===========================================================================
  322: 
  323: %% Ensure that a failed decode in Failed-AVP is acceptable, and that
  324: %% the component AVPs are decoded if possible.
  325: failed_error() ->
  326:     Avps = [{279, [{295, <<0:32>>},    %% Failed-AVP, Termination-Cause
  327:                    {258, <<1:32>>},             %% Auth-Application-Id
  328:                    {284, [{280, "Proxy-Host"},  %% Proxy-Info
  329:                           {33, "Proxy-State"},
  330:                           {295, <<0:32>>},      %% Termination-Cause, invalid
  331:                           {258, <<2:32>>}]}]}], %% Auth-Application-Id
  332:     #diameter_packet{avps = [[#diameter_avp{code = 279},
  333:                               #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  334:                                             value = undefined,
  335:                                             data = <<0:32>>},
  336:                               #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  337:                                             value = 1,
  338:                                             data = <<1:32>>},
  339:                               [#diameter_avp{code = 284},
  340:                                #diameter_avp{code = 280},
  341:                                #diameter_avp{code = 33},
  342:                                #diameter_avp{code = 295,
  343:                                              value = undefined},
  344:                                #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  345:                                              value = 2,
  346:                                              data = <<2:32>>}]]],
  347:                      errors = []}
  348:         = sta(repkg(sta(Avps))).
  349: 
  350: %% ===========================================================================
  351: 
  352: %% str/1
  353: 
  354: str(#diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 263},
  355:                              #diameter_avp{code = 264},
  356:                              #diameter_avp{code = 296},
  357:                              #diameter_avp{code = 283},
  358:                              #diameter_avp{code = 258,
  359:                                            value = 0}
  360:                              | T]}
  361:     = Pkt) ->
  362:     Pkt#diameter_packet{avps = T};
  363: 
  364: str(Avps) ->
  365:     OH = "diameter.erlang.org",
  366:     OR = "erlang.org",
  367:     DR = "example.com",
  368:     Sid = "diameter.erlang.org;123;456",
  369: 
  370:     [#diameter_header{version = 1,
  371:                       cmd_code = 275,  %% STR
  372:                       is_request = true,
  373:                       application_id = 0,
  374:                       hop_by_hop_id = 17,
  375:                       end_to_end_id = 42,
  376:                       is_proxiable = false,
  377:                       is_error = false,
  378:                       is_retransmitted = false}
  379:      | avp([{263, Sid},  %% Session-Id
  380:             {264, OH},   %% Origin-Host
  381:             {296, OR},   %% Origin-Realm
  382:             {283, DR},   %% Destination-Realm
  383:             {258, <<0:32>>}]  %% Auth-Application-Id
  384:            ++ Avps)].
  385: 
  386: %% sta/1
  387: 
  388: sta(#diameter_packet{avps = [#diameter_avp{code = 263},
  389:                              #diameter_avp{code = 268},
  390:                              #diameter_avp{code = 264},
  391:                              #diameter_avp{code = 296},
  392:                              #diameter_avp{code = 278,
  393:                                            value = 4}
  394:                              | T]}
  395:     = Pkt) ->
  396:     Pkt#diameter_packet{avps = T};
  397: 
  398: sta(Avps) ->
  399:     OH = "diameter.erlang.org",
  400:     OR = "erlang.org",
  401:     Sid = "diameter.erlang.org;123;456",
  402: 
  403:     [#diameter_header{version = 1,
  404:                       cmd_code = 275,  %% STA
  405:                       is_request = false,
  406:                       application_id = 0,
  407:                       hop_by_hop_id = 17,
  408:                       end_to_end_id = 42,
  409:                       is_proxiable = false,
  410:                       is_error = false,
  411:                       is_retransmitted = false}
  412:      | avp([{263, Sid},         %% Session-Id
  413:             {268, <<2002:32>>}, %% Result-Code
  414:             {264, OH},          %% Origin-Host
  415:             {296, OR},          %% Origin-Realm
  416:             {278, <<4:32>>}]    %% Origin-State-Id
  417:            ++ Avps)].
  418: 
  419: avp({Code, Data}) ->
  420:     #diameter_avp{code = Code,
  421:                   data = avp(Data)};
  422: 
  423: avp(#diameter_avp{} = A) ->
  424:     A;
  425: 
  426: avp([{_,_} | _] = Avps) ->
  427:     lists:map(fun avp/1, Avps);
  428: 
  429: avp(V) ->
  430:     V.
  431: 
  432: %% repkg/1
  433: 
  434: repkg(Msg) ->
  435:     recode(Msg, diameter_gen_base_rfc6733).
  436: 
  437: recode(#diameter_packet{} = Pkt, Dict) ->
  438:     diameter_codec:decode(Dict, opts(Dict), diameter_codec:encode(Dict, Pkt));
  439: 
  440: recode(Msg, Dict) ->
  441:     recode(#diameter_packet{msg = Msg}, Dict).
  442: 
  443: opts(Mod) ->
  444:     #{app_dictionary => Mod,
  445:       decode_format => record,
  446:       string_decode => false,
  447:       strict_mbit => true,
  448:       rfc => 6733,
  449:       failed_avp => false}.
